intro: Aeranthes hispidula, commonly known as the hairy violet, is a species of flowering plant in the family Iridaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features showy, violet-colored flowers with a distinctive hairy texture on its leaves and stems. It is often found in open, sunny habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it prefers well-drained soil and full sun.
